de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.networking

Class DiscoveryClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.discovery.DiscoveryThread
        • de.ovgu.softwareprojektapp.networking.DiscoveryClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DiscoveryClient
extends DiscoveryThread
    This thread manages sending discovery request packages and receiving answers from servers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiscoveryClient

        public DiscoveryClient(OnDiscoveryListener listener,
                       ExceptionListener exceptionListener,
                       int remotePort,
                       java.lang.String selfName)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new DiscoveryClient. In contrast to the DiscoveryServer, the DiscoveryClient does not have to know its command- and data port yet, because we can instantiate those when acutally connecting to the ports supplied in the discovery response sent by the sever.
        Parameters:
        listener - this listener will be notified of changes in the list of known servers
        remotePort - the port the discovery server listens on
        selfName - the name this device should announce itself as
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onDiscovery

        protected void onDiscovery(NetworkDevice device)
        When a server is discovered, check if we already know it; if not, add it to the list, and notify our listener.
        Specified by:
        onDiscovery in class DiscoveryThread
        Parameters:
        device - the newly found device
